name: Backpack
description: A backpack is a sturdy cloth or leather bag with shoulder straps, used to carry equipment and supplies on long journeys or adventures.

name: Rations
description: Rations are a supply of non-perishable food that can be carried on long journeys or used in emergency situations. Iron rations are made up of hardtack, dried meat, and nuts, while standard rations include bread, cheese, and dried fruit.

name: Waterskin
description: A waterskin is a leather or animal bladder container used to carry water or other liquids while traveling.

name: Torch
description: A torch is a long stick with a flammable material at one end, used for providing light in dark places. The most common material used for the flame is a piece of cloth soaked in oil or wax.

name: Lantern
description: A lantern is a portable light source, typically featuring a protective enclosure to prevent the flame from being extinguished by wind or rain. It can be fueled by oil, wax, or magic.

name: Rope (hemp or silk)
description: A length of rope made from either hemp or silk. It can be used for climbing, tying up prisoners, or securing items.

name: Grappling Hook
description: A grappling hook is a metal hook attached to a length of rope or chain, used to climb or descend walls, cliffs, or other obstacles.

name: Lockpicks
description: Lockpicks are a set of slender metal tools used by thieves and rogues to pick locks. They consist of a variety of hooks, rakes, and tension wrenches, and require a steady hand and a keen eye to use effectively.

name: Crowbar
description: A crowbar is a long, metal tool with a flattened and curved end, used for prying open doors, crates, and other objects. It can also be used as a makeshift weapon in a pinch.

name: Climbing Gear
description: Climbing gear is a set of tools used by adventurers to scale mountains, cliffs, and other steep terrain. It includes pitons, which are metal spikes driven into rock to provide anchor points; carabiners, which are metal loops used to connect ropes and other gear; and a harness, which is worn by the climber to attach themselves to the rope and provide support.

name: Map and Compass
description: A map and compass are essential tools for any adventurer. The map provides a detailed layout of the surrounding area, while the compass helps to navigate and orient oneself.

name: Healer's Kit
description: A healer's kit is a collection of bandages, salves, and other supplies used by healers to mend wounds and cure ailments. It includes antiseptic ointments, splints, and other medical tools.

name: Tent
description: A tent is a portable shelter made of fabric or other material stretched over a supporting framework of poles or ropes. It provides a place to sleep and shelter from the elements while adventuring.

name: Mirror
description: A mirror is a reflective surface that can be used to see one's own reflection. It is often made of glass or polished metal and can come in various shapes and sizes.

name: 10-Foot Pole
description: A 10-foot pole is a long, sturdy wooden pole that can be used to probe dangerous areas, test for traps, or even as a makeshift weapon.

name: Blanket or Bedroll
description: A blanket or bedroll is a thick, warm covering made of wool, fur, or other materials, used to keep adventurers warm and comfortable while sleeping outdoors.

name: Flint and Steel
description: A flint and steel is a small kit consisting of a piece of flint and a small metal striker. When struck together, they create sparks that can be used to start a fire.

name: Potion Vials
description: Potion vials are small glass containers used to hold various magical concoctions. They come in various shapes and sizes, and are often adorned with intricate designs and symbols.

name: Sack or Bag
description: A sack or bag is a simple container made of cloth, leather, or other materials, used to carry small items or provisions. It can be tied or closed with a drawstring or flap.

name: Spyglass
description: A spyglass is a handheld optical instrument used to magnify distant objects. It consists of two lenses, one at each end of a hollow tube, that are aligned to create a magnified image.
